findings.title: Unencrypted Private Data On-Chain
findings.description: Private data is stored unencrypted on-chain, potentially exposing sensitive information.

findings.description: The presence of Right-To-Left Override control character (U+202E) can lead to potential security issues.

findings.description: The smart contract allows writing data to arbitrary storage locations, which can lead to unauthorized modifications and potential security breaches.

findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Lack of Proper Signature Verification
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Missing Protection against Signature Replay Attacks
findings.description: The contract does not protect against signature replay attacks.

findings.title: Weak Sources of Randomness from Chain Attributes
findings.description: The contract uses chain attributes (e.g., block.timestamp, block.number) as a source of randomness, which can be predictable and exploitable.

findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Incorrect Constructor Name

findings.title: Signature Malleability
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Block values as a proxy for time
findings.description: Using block values (e.g., block.number or block.timestamp) as a proxy for time can be insecure because it allows miners to manipulate the timestamp.

findings.title: Authorization through tx.origin
findings.description: Using tx.origin for authorization can lead to vulnerabilities as it can be manipulated by attackers.

findings.description: N/A

findings.title: DoS with Failed Call
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Delegate call to Untrusted Callee
findings.description: A delegate call is made to an untrusted callee, which can lead to unauthorized access or manipulation of sensitive data.

findings.title: Use of Deprecated Solidity Functions
findings.description: The contract uses deprecated solidity functions which can lead to security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Assert Violation
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Uninitialized Storage Pointer
findings.description: The storage pointer is not initialized before being used.

findings.title: State Variable Default Visibility
findings.description: The default visibility of state variables is public, which can lead to unintended access and modification.

findings.title: Reentrancy
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Unprotected SELFDESTRUCT Instruction
findings.description: The contract contains an unprotected SELFDESTRUCT instruction, which can lead to unintended destruction of the contract.

findings.title: Unprotected Ether Withdrawal
findings.description: The smart contract allows unauthorized withdrawal of ether.

findings.title: Unchecked Call Return Value
findings.description: The return value of a call is not checked.

findings.title: Floating Pragma
findings.description: A floating pragma is set (SWC-103)

findings.title: Outdated Compiler Version
findings.description: The compiler version used to compile the contract is outdated.

findings.title: Integer Overflow and Underflow
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Function Default Visibility
findings.description: Functions with default visibility can lead to unintended access and manipulation of contract state.

findings.title: Admin can set new admin address
findings.description: The contract allows an administrator to set a new admin address.

findings.title: Admin can set new implementation address
findings.description: The admin has the capability to update the implementation address.

findings.title: Contract is a proxy contract
findings.description: The contract uses a proxy pattern which can introduce additional complexity and potential security risks.
